description_txt: stated on July 23, 2009 in an op-ed for National Review:
quote_txt: The Democrat-backed health care reform plan "will require (Americans) to subsidize abortion with their hard-earned tax dollars."

description_txt: stated on July 29, 2009 in a memo on the group's Web site.:
quote_txt: Page 992 of the health care bill will "establish school-based 'health' clinics. Your children will be indoctrinated and your grandchildren may be aborted!"

description_txt: stated on August 5, 2009 in a blog posting.:
quote_txt: During the 2005 fight over Social Security, "there were noisy demonstrations — but they were outside the events," and opponents were "not disruptive — crowds booed lines they didn’t like, but that was about it."

description_txt: stated on August 4, 2009 in a news release:
quote_txt: Health care reform legislation is “likely to mandate free ‘sex change’ surgeries.”

description_txt: stated on August 4, 2009 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: The health care reform plan would set limits similar to the "socialized" system in Britain, where people are allowed to die if their treatment would cost more than $22,000.

description_txt: stated on July 10, 2009 in an email to supporters:
quote_txt: A loophole "still exists which allows members of Congress and high-powered executive branch appointees to exploit 'insider' knowledge of the financial industry in order to turn personal profit."

description_txt: stated on August 5, 2009 in a speech in Wakarusa, Ind.:
quote_txt: Stimulus tax cuts "began showing up in paychecks of 4.8 million Indiana households about three months ago."

description_txt: stated on August 2, 2009 in CNN's State of the Union with John King:
quote_txt: Under President George W. Bush, the U.S. "spent $1.3 trillion on tax cuts for the wealthy" and "trillions" each on a war and on Medicare drug benefits.

description_txt: stated on August 2, 2009 in on This Week with George Stephanopoulos:
quote_txt: A former Clinton administration official and other economists agree that "if you keep extending these temporary unemployment benefits, you're just going to extend joblessness even more."

description_txt: stated on August 2, 2009 in an interview on CNN's State of the Union:
quote_txt: "The John McCain Twitter account has more than 1.1 million followers. The official White House Twitter account has only about 830,000."

description_txt: stated on July 31, 2009 in the Glenn Beck show:
quote_txt: If you log into the government's Cash for Clunkers Web site (cars.gov) from your home computer, the government can "seize all of your personal and private" information, and track your computer activity.

description_txt: stated on July 28, 2009 in a speech on the House floor:
quote_txt: President Barack Obama suggested on national TV that the Democratic health care bill "will have government decide" that a healthy, 100-year-old woman in need of a pacemaker "should take a pain pill" instead.

description_txt: stated on July 20, 2009 in a town hall meeting in Missouri.:
quote_txt: "The Congressional Budget Office most recently came out and analyzed the current (health care) plan and said that it was not only deficit-neutral, but also that over 10 years it would create a $6 billion surplus."

description_txt: stated on July 28, 2009 in a speech on the House floor:
quote_txt: "53 percent of Americans cut back on their health care in the last year because of costs."

description_txt: stated on July 28, 2009 in a speech on the House floor:
quote_txt: Forty-five percent of Americans went without needed care because of costs in 2007.

description_txt: stated on July 28, 2009 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: "All non-US citizens, illegal or not, will be provided with free health care services."

description_txt: stated on July 28, 2009 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: "All private healthcare plans must conform to government rules to participate in a Healthcare Exchange."

description_txt: stated on July 28, 2009 in a chain e-mail:
quote_txt: In the health care bill, "The 'Health Choices Commissioner' will decide health benefits for you. You will have no choice. None."

description_txt: stated on July 22, 2009 in his TV program:
quote_txt: John Holdren, director of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy, "has proposed forcing abortions and putting sterilants in the drinking water to control population."

description_txt: stated on July 14, 2009 in a chain email:
quote_txt: "The Senate voted this week to allow illegal aliens access to Social Security benefits."

description_txt: stated on July 26, 2009 in This Week with George Stephanopoulos:
quote_txt: Only 15 percent of drug users are African-American, yet 74 percent of all drug offenders sentenced to prison are black

description_txt: stated on July 26, 2009 in CNN's State of the Union with John King:
quote_txt: "Four percent of American citizens are black males, but they are 35 percent of murder victims."

description_txt: stated on June 17, 2009 in an advertisement:
quote_txt: White House spokesman Robert Gibbs "lied" when he said President Obama's birth certificate is posted on the Internet.

description_txt: stated on July 22, 2009 in a speech on health care reform:
quote_txt: "Doctors, nurses, hospitals, even the pharmaceutical industry, (and) AARP" say that health reform "makes sense to do."

description_txt: stated on July 22, 2009 in a news conference.:
quote_txt: "14,000 Americans . . . lose their health insurance every single day."

description_txt: stated on July 16, 2009 in on the Fred Thompson radio show:
quote_txt: The health care reform bill "would make it mandatory — absolutely require — that every five years people in Medicare have a required counseling session that will tell them how to end their life sooner."

description_txt: stated on July 22, 2009 in a press conference:
quote_txt: Health insurance companies are "making record profits, right now."

description_txt: stated on July 21, 2009 in a statement on the House floor.:
quote_txt: There were more job losses per month in the last three months under President Bush than in the past three months under President Obama.

description_txt: stated on July 15, 2009 in an editorial.:
quote_txt: The health care reform bill -- on Page 16 -- outlaws private insurance.

description_txt: stated on July 17, 2009 in the House Republicans' Web site:
quote_txt: "The government is going to tell Americans they need to replace functioning stoves in their homes with 'government-certified' stoves and use taxpayer dollars to do so."
